snippet.textDisplay:
The criticism of "weaponising lightspeed" is not only petty, it doesn't even make any sense. 1) Lightspeed exists in the Star Wars universe. 2) It was firmly established by Han Solo in 1977 (in case it wasn't already obvious) that you had to be very careful about plotting your course before making the jump, because colliding with objects at light-speed would be catastrophic. 3) There doesn't seem to be any reason to suppose it would be any less catastrophic for the object you collide with than for yourself.


So.. what does Roz think SHOULD be the result of aiming your ship directly at another ship and jumping to lightspeed, if not the destruction of both ships? It makes complete sense in-universe that it would work - because there's literally no conceivable reason why it wouldn't, and there is no in-universe "rule" broken. If your problem with it is just that nobody's ever done it before, then your problem isn't with Johnson, it's with every writer that came before him to whom it never occurred, because not only did they not have their characters use it, they didn't establish any reason for their characters NOT to use it. Other than, of course, not wanting to sacrifice their own lives if other alternatives existed. For Holder, NO other alternatives exist, making it not only an entirely logical strategy, but the ONLY logical strategy. Identifying this as a story weakness is just weird and wrong, and reeks of going out of your way to invent alleged plot "flaws" in a movie you already don't like for other reasons.


To put it another way, Roz's argument is like saying Kamikaze pilots in a WWII movie are ridiculous because if you could do that then EVERY pilot in WWI would have done that.


And the fact that he has a problem with this entirely logical and in-universe-consistent use of light-speed, but DOESN'T have a problem with the in-universe-rule-trashing way its used in Rise of Skywalker is indicative of the fact that he's giving all the passes to the one he likes, and unfairly judging the choices made by the one he doesn't.
snippet.textOriginal:
The criticism of "weaponising lightspeed" is not only petty, it doesn't even make any sense.  1) Lightspeed exists in the Star Wars universe. 2)  It was firmly established by Han Solo in 1977 (in case it wasn't already obvious) that you had to be very careful about plotting your course before making the jump, because colliding with objects at light-speed would be catastrophic. 3) There doesn't seem to be any reason to suppose it would be any less catastrophic for the object you collide with than for yourself.


So.. what does Roz think SHOULD be the result of aiming your ship directly at another ship and jumping to lightspeed, if not the destruction of both ships?  It makes complete sense in-universe that it would work - because there's literally no conceivable reason why it wouldn't, and there is no in-universe "rule" broken.  If your problem with it is just that nobody's ever done it before, then your problem isn't with Johnson, it's with every writer that came before him to whom it never occurred, because not only did they not have their characters use it,  they didn't establish any reason for their characters NOT to use it.  Other than, of course, not wanting to sacrifice their own lives if other alternatives existed.  For Holder, NO other alternatives exist, making it not only an entirely logical strategy, but the ONLY logical strategy.  Identifying this as a story weakness is just weird and wrong, and reeks of going out of your way to invent alleged plot "flaws" in a movie you already don't like for other reasons. 


To put it another way, Roz's argument is like saying Kamikaze pilots in a WWII movie are ridiculous because if you could do that then EVERY pilot in WWI would have done that.


And the fact that he has a problem with this entirely logical and in-universe-consistent use of light-speed, but DOESN'T have a problem with the in-universe-rule-trashing way its used in Rise of Skywalker is indicative of the fact that he's giving all the passes to the one he likes, and unfairly judging the choices made by the one he doesn't.

snippet.textDisplay:
Let's go down the criticisms of TLJ that he mentions:
1. He splits up the gang. Actually the gang was split up at the end of TFA when Rey went to find Luke and Finn was incapacitated. But sure, blame Rian Johnson.
2. Weaponizing lightspeed is a problem, but a fixable one...can easily have been written out as the ship had some sort of prototype shield or something that it can't be replicated.
3. People arrested for a parking ticket. There is more world building in just that scene than there is in JJ's 2 movies
4. Wasted Snoke? How? He was an obstacle to overcome for Kylo ascent...I don't need to know what little league team he played on in 6th grade. Snoke is only in 3 minutes of TFA
5. Wasted Phasma? She had a better showing than in TFA.
6. Didn't waste Rey's history at all, in fact a lot of people feel this is the best story beat in the entire trilogy. Rey desperately wanted to be someone/anyone that finding out she is no one shakes her to her core. Also, her being a no one makes the galaxy larger....meaning the force doesn't just belong to a few bloodlines.
7. As opposed to having infinite fuel?
8. Blame JJ for leaving him on the island to begin with...a choice JJ made because he felt Luke overshadowed all the other characters. And a shoulder brush? That's just nitpicky as hell.
9. The Finn suicide mission would have been pointless, it was already stated it was too late to hit the canon. Finn's willingness to give his life for the resistance was the completion of his story arc. Rose's speech is actually the completion of Poe's.
....I can't make someone like a movie, but jesus christ be consistent with complaints and stop blaming Rian for things that could have been done in TFA (Rey's heritage, Snoke's backstory, Phasma being wasted). There are 2 real reasons everyone hates on Rian is he killed fan theories and because of the anti-SJW crowd.

snippet.textDisplay: People should stop trying to compare Marvel to Star Wars, they're different beasts. I liked "Skywalker" but as an avid Marvel comic reader I was way more disappointed by IW and more so "Endgame", IMO Endgame was an unholy mess of a film saved by a bunch of fan-service. The time travel elements were full of plot holes, the end war had next to no stakes and the unexpected Black Widow death was a slap in the face to fans. But, I find it hard to criticize Marvel films because fans come after you.
snippet.textOriginal: People should stop trying to compare Marvel to Star Wars, they're different beasts. I liked "Skywalker" but as an avid Marvel comic reader I was way more disappointed by IW and more so "Endgame", IMO Endgame was an unholy mess of a film saved by a bunch of fan-service. The time travel elements were full of plot holes, the end war had next to no stakes and the unexpected Black Widow death was a slap in the face to fans. But, I find it hard to criticize Marvel films because fans come after you.

snippet.textDisplay: Keeping it real, neither Johnson or Abraham handles the franchise well. Abraham was WAY too concerned with pandering to the older fans that he basically just rewrote A New Hope and Return of the Jedi, and while Johnson took some risks, he made a few really horrible decisions like that weak casino planet storyline. In the end, the sequel trilogy has been moderately entertaining and at least better than the prequels, but no where near as good as the original trilogy. The only truly good Star Wars movie since Return of the Jedi has been Rogue One. I think it’s time to move away from the main storyline finally and come up with something really original.
snippet.textOriginal: Keeping it real, neither Johnson or Abraham handles the franchise well. Abraham was WAY too concerned with pandering to the older fans that he basically just rewrote A New Hope and Return of the Jedi, and while Johnson took some risks, he made a few really horrible decisions like that weak casino planet storyline. In the end, the sequel trilogy has been moderately entertaining and at least better than the prequels, but no where near as good as the original trilogy. The only truly good Star Wars movie since Return of the Jedi has been Rogue One. I think it’s time to move away from the main storyline finally and come up with something really original.

Roz will not be on mainstream media outlets for long. the last thing they want to hear is the truth. it won't be long before he is labelled a racist or misgonyst or alt-right supporter, and even a white supremacist. the alt-left don't want to deal with reason or truth, so instead they flood the MSM with hate and fear. this is not his first time bashing female-lead movies. To be fair, Hollywood has yet to produce a single good one, with the possible exception of Wonder Woman....in fact they are all well below average to just plain bad.

The Rise of Skywalker, is really THE RISE OF 3RD WAVE FEMINISM. Kathleen Kennedy took over Disney's Star Wars many years ago. She is a RAGING Feminist, and a man-hater. She support every conceivable SJW cause. this, she proudly reflects in her movies with the overall tone of.....Men as useless idiots to be controlled and have no real use....women know everything and are all powerful and are responsible for all-things good.

We've seen many Feminist movies from Hollywood, and all of them have been box office fails. Even in failure, Feminists don't blame the bad acting or the horrible writing of the SJW deafening tones......they blame men for bashing the movie and somehow encouraging people to not see it. The fact that women can't responsibility for producing crap, and blame men for it, is telling. The fact that they have not learned that people want to be entertained and not have SJW issues preached to them, is telling. The fact that they can't give up, will result in Hollywood being just a voice for Feminism and SJW narrative and Liberalism/Socialist ideology. There will be no entertainment value....well beyond watching women going ballistic at their failures and blaming it on men....cause that is, in itself, VERY fun to watch.

snippet.textDisplay: I very much agree with him. Was it perfect, no. Did it have problems? Yes. But did I enjoy myself? Hell yes. It course corrects a lot of shit from TLJ. While that in itself causes a lot of the issues with the film, it still salvages the story enough to make this a fun movie experience without things pissing me off like the last movie or Solo.
snippet.textOriginal: I very much agree with him. Was it perfect, no. Did it have problems? Yes. But did I enjoy myself? Hell yes. It course corrects a lot of shit from TLJ. While that in itself causes a lot of the issues with the film, it still salvages the story enough to make this a fun movie experience without things pissing me off like the last movie or Solo.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree pretty strongly with this review. I hated so much about the Last Jedi and while I certainly don't love everything about Rise of Skywalker there are things the film gets right. JJ tried to cram way too much into this movie, and I dislike Palpatine returning, but it's very obvious he at least tried to listen to the fans which is refreshing to see. I also like that he has taken the criticism of this film diplomatically and hasn't thrown insults at those who disagree with his choices. One of the biggest issues with The Rise of Skywalker continues to be that it follows up The Last Jedi and therefore has to try to fix the mess that movie created. This entire trilogy's downfall is that there was no road map lined up going into it and therefore the continuity is all over the place. Having said that at least this movie at least partly honors the films that came before it and brings parts of the entire saga full circle which I really appreciate.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree pretty strongly with this review. I hated so much about the Last Jedi and while I certainly don't love everything about Rise of Skywalker there are things the film gets right. JJ tried to cram way too much into this movie, and I dislike Palpatine returning, but it's very obvious he at least tried to listen to the fans which is refreshing to see. I also like that he has taken the criticism of this film diplomatically and hasn't thrown insults at those who disagree with his choices. One of the biggest issues with The Rise of Skywalker continues to be that it follows up The Last Jedi and therefore has to try to fix the mess that movie created. This entire trilogy's downfall is that there was no road map lined up going into it and therefore the continuity is all over the place. Having said that at least this movie at least partly honors the films that came before it and brings parts of the entire saga full circle which I really appreciate.

snippet.textDisplay: The whole Disney trilogy stinks.  It suffers from bad writing.  I can tolerate a lot of plot holes and random changes in the world building (such as force powers becoming greater and greater...lighting bolts coming from force ghosts, etc.)  What I can't tolerate is senseless actions from the characters, no motivations, no character arcs, no logic, no respect for the previous movies in the franchise.  The whole trilogy is bad.  We can debate which chapter was the worst.  But it doesn't matter.  Rey is so boring I just don't care anymore.
snippet.textOriginal: The whole Disney trilogy stinks.  It suffers from bad writing.  I can tolerate a lot of plot holes and random changes in the world building (such as force powers becoming greater and greater...lighting bolts coming from force ghosts, etc.)  What I can't tolerate is senseless actions from the characters, no motivations, no character arcs, no logic, no respect for the previous movies in the franchise.  The whole trilogy is bad.  We can debate which chapter was the worst.  But it doesn't matter.  Rey is so boring I just don't care anymore.

Baby today did NOT “save” Star Wars.
It might help make the mandalorian better, but the entire sequel trilogy is garbage.

This guys opinion is skewed by his disappointment from last Jedi. This movie IS BAD.

Regarding the gay kiss.
If it’s in the background and isn’t even characters that matter, think about what that means.
It is NOT to make American audiences happy like this dude claims.
What percentage of Americans are gay?
It’s to make that small % happy?
No. It’s more agenda stuff, just like “the force is female”, but relegated to near subliminal measures.

https://williamsinstitute.law.ucla.edu/williams-in-the-news/how-many-people-are-gay/

That’s stupid AF.

snippet.textDisplay:
Last Jedi was a better movie in every way. You wanna complain about rebels not using kamikaze light speed sooner? How about how everyone who has ever died could have been brought back with 'force healing'. Hell, even after Kylo healed Rey, and Kylo died, couldn't she have just then healed Kylo again and brought him back to life?
If we ignore our expectations from rotten tomatoes, this last movie was the worst. You can say Last Jedi was overrated when it came out, but certainly not the worst. Not even when counting plot holes.
snippet.textOriginal:
Last Jedi was a better movie in every way. You wanna complain about rebels not using kamikaze light speed sooner? How about how everyone who has ever died could have been brought back with 'force healing'. Hell, even after Kylo healed Rey, and Kylo died, couldn't she have just then healed Kylo again and brought him back to life? 
If we ignore our expectations from rotten tomatoes, this last movie was the worst. You can say Last Jedi was overrated when it came out, but certainly not the worst. Not even when counting plot holes.

snippet.textDisplay: Rotten Tomatoes is a LIE.... From 2k reviews all the way, well the last time I checked, to around 30-40k reviews, it was stuck at 86%. That would be mathematically impossible. Especially since it's pretty much, at minimum, 86% of the people seeing this are life long fans hoping that this movie really did fix it. Since it took away the entire Skywalker saga and made it mainly a Palpatine saga, I'm going to say, there is no way it got an 86% fan score.

snippet.textDisplay: What is the hang up that Vader’s redemption is ruined or tarnished? That doesn’t make sense to me. His redemption was turning to the light side and helping his son when he needed him the most. It doesn’t matter whether Palpatine wasn’t killed. That has nothing to do with the redemption. The main thing is that he stood up against his master and took matters into his own hands to save Luke. That’s the redemption. He felt for his son. He wanted to save him.
snippet.textOriginal: What is the hang up that Vader’s redemption is ruined or tarnished? That doesn’t make sense to me. His redemption was turning to the light side and helping his son when he needed him the most. It doesn’t matter whether Palpatine wasn’t killed. That has nothing to do with the redemption. The main thing is that he stood up against his master and took matters into his own hands to save Luke. That’s the redemption. He felt for his son. He wanted to save him.

snippet.textDisplay: These three films did irreparably more damage to the OT than even the prequels ever did or could have. It's gonna be sad watching those first legendary movies and having to have this Disney rubbish in the back of my mind. If anything can help me reconcile my frustration, it's that stories like Jedi  Outcast: Jedi Knight 2 came out first and were considered canon first. I don't care if Disney spent money, George had nothing to do with this garbage, while he had previously declared games like Jedi Outcast and KOTOR canon in their time. Those were the true past and future of this universe, not this excrement that Disney calls the Sequel Trilogy.
snippet.textOriginal: These three films did irreparably more damage to the OT than even the prequels ever did or could have. It's gonna be sad watching those first legendary movies and having to have this Disney rubbish in the back of my mind. If anything can help me reconcile my frustration, it's that stories like Jedi  Outcast: Jedi Knight 2 came out first and were considered canon first. I don't care if Disney spent money, George had nothing to do with this garbage, while he had previously declared games like Jedi Outcast and KOTOR canon in their time. Those were the true past and future of this universe, not this excrement that Disney calls the Sequel Trilogy.

snippet.textDisplay: I walked out as soon as Palpatine was killed by his own force lightning.  “I don’t know what to do with my hands!” Is on his tombstone. They thought they were clever with this because Rey couldn’t kill him at the risk of Palpatine essentially stealing her body so they decided to have him “Kill himself” 😱😱😱, damn so clever but guess what chums he still died and there was no discussion about involuntary suicide excluding him from body snatching.  Fuck this movie.

snippet.textDisplay:
Poe has a story arc???? He smuggled spice or some shit? Really?? That’s the arc??? Please😒...
Finn and Poe are pointless characters ultimately. No point to them at all. Rey, while it we’ve heard it all before, had and arc. Kylo definitely had an arc and made some sense (and that’s mostly down to Adam). But Poe and Finn? I honestly could care less about and that’s mostly because the writers have given me NOTHING to cling onto. No humour, no emotion, interesting quirk or character flaw. Nothing.

snippet.textDisplay:
The takeaway lesson from this, is that you need a roadmap/concrete outline of a story before you film a trilogy.

Why was this lost on Disney? But as usual, Roz makes a some very salient and hilarious comments.

snippet.textDisplay:
No man. This movie was a mess.

It took 3 movies and still no character development or good fighting scenes.

Abrams dug his own hole and Johnson was clearly a liberal low life who you knew nothing of Star Wars.

This last movie was corny and uninteresting. The fights were terrible and predictable wym!? Disney has ruined one of the most untouchable sagas ...

snippet.textDisplay: Dude. The lightsaber fights were unimaginative and weak. Seriously, after the genius fight choreography of the Marvel movies everyone else needs to up their game. The bar has been raised and Abrams couldn't jump it. There wasn't a single mind blowing lightsaber fight in all three of these movies. Not one.
snippet.textOriginal: Dude. The lightsaber fights were unimaginative and weak. Seriously, after the genius fight choreography of the Marvel movies everyone else needs to up their game. The bar has been raised and Abrams couldn't jump it. There wasn't a single mind blowing lightsaber fight in all three of these movies. Not one.
